activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11025
activity.text:
> Let's keep the solution simple, I'd say we can simply say update the label to "Description (supports markdown)"

True, we could just change the label to be "Description (supports [markdown](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/))" and perhaps hyperlink "markdown" in the label to some markdown documentation. 

This way users who are unfamiliar with markdown can just click the link to learn more.

@rithviknishad do you think it would be nice to still have an example/template in the description as a placeholder as outlined? 

Either way, I'm confident I could have a  simple pr ready for review in a day or two :)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11025
activity.text:
Hi @abhimanyurajeesh , I think this would be a great first issue!

Here's what I would do if I were to be assigned:

-  Having a markdown template perhaps as a placeholder to only show the essentials ( headings, bold text, bullet points)
-  The markdown template would use example placeholder text pertaining to a facility/hospital to give users better context
-  more detailed information on using markdown by having a link next to the description label (perhaps using a tooltip)

A question I have is:
- Should embedding of images/urls using markdown be allowed on descriptions?

Additional considerations:
- I think the preview or rich in-built editors are also good solutions, that could be added later on.

If assigned, I'm confident I could have a PR ready in 1-2 days.
